_meta.legalNote: Official Epic Games YouTube content only.

resources.title: Your First Hour in Unreal Engine 5
resources.description: Official Epic walkthrough of the UE5 editor interface, viewport navigation, content browser, and basic level editing. Perfect starting point for absolute beginners.
keyTakeaways: Navigate the 3D viewport using WASD + right-click mouse look
Use the Content Browser to import and organize assets
Place actors in a level and adjust transforms (location, rotation, scale)
Understand the difference between the World Outliner and Details panel

resources.title: Unreal Engine 5 Beginner Tutorial - UE5 Starter Course
resources.description: Comprehensive beginner course covering Blueprints, materials, lighting, and level design. A full 5-hour guided project that builds a complete game environment.
keyTakeaways: Create and connect Blueprint nodes for gameplay logic
Build basic materials with texture samples and parameters
Set up directional, point, and spot lights for a scene
Combine all skills to build a playable game level from scratch

resources.title: Building Open Worlds in Unreal Engine 5
resources.description: Deep dive into building large open worlds using World Partition, landscape tools, and data layers. Covers streaming, HLOD, and performance strategies for massive maps.
keyTakeaways: Enable and configure World Partition for automatic level streaming
Use the Landscape tool to sculpt terrain with layers and materials
Set up Data Layers to organize streaming content by gameplay region
Optimize open world performance with HLOD and distance culling

resources.title: Nanite | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official Inside Unreal episode covering Nanite virtualized geometry — how it works, when to use it, performance characteristics, and integration with other systems like Lumen.
keyTakeaways: Understand how Nanite eliminates traditional LOD workflows
Enable Nanite on Static Meshes via the mesh editor settings
Know which geometry types support Nanite (and which don't — skeletal, translucent)
Profile Nanite performance using stat Nanite and GPU visualizations

resources.title: Lumen | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official Inside Unreal episode on Lumen — UE5's dynamic global illumination and reflection system. Covers setup, performance tuning, and visual quality settings.
keyTakeaways: Understand Lumen's software ray tracing vs hardware ray tracing modes
Configure Lumen GI quality through Post Process Volume settings
Set up Lumen reflections using reflection capture actors as fallbacks
Tune performance by adjusting Lumen Scene Detail and Final Gather Quality

resources.title: Niagara VFX - Getting Started
resources.description: Official introduction to UE5's Niagara VFX system — emitters, modules, particle spawning, and creating fire/smoke/spark effects from scratch.
keyTakeaways: Create a Niagara System and add Emitters for different effect layers
Use Spawn Rate, Lifetime, and Initial Velocity modules to control particles
Apply Curl Noise Force and Drag modules for organic motion
Combine multiple emitters for complex effects (fire = flames + embers + smoke)

resources.title: Animation in UE5 | Feature Highlight
resources.description: Official feature highlight covering UE5 animation tools — Animation Blueprints, Control Rig, IK Retargeting, and the new animation workflow improvements.
keyTakeaways: Set up an Animation Blueprint with State Machines for locomotion
Use Control Rig for procedural animation adjustments and IK
Retarget animations between different skeletal meshes using IK Retargeter
Blend animations using Blend Spaces for smooth directional movement

resources.title: Procedural Content Generation Framework
resources.description: Official deep dive into UE5.2's Procedural Content Generation (PCG) framework — rules, data layers, point sampling, and generating landscapes procedurally.
keyTakeaways: Create a PCG Graph with Point Samplers and Surface Projectors
Use filters and density modifiers to control asset placement
Set up exclusion volumes and bias rules for natural-looking distribution
Combine PCG with landscape layers for context-aware procedural placement

resources.title: MetaSounds in Unreal Engine
resources.description: Introduction to MetaSounds — UE5's node-based audio system for procedural sound design, music, and real-time audio synthesis.
keyTakeaways: Create a MetaSound Source and build audio graphs with oscillators
Use Trigger and Envelope nodes for event-driven sound playback
Connect gameplay parameters to MetaSound inputs for reactive audio
Replace legacy SoundCue workflows with MetaSounds for better performance

resources.title: Chaos Physics System Overview
resources.description: Official overview of UE5's Chaos physics system — rigid body simulation, destruction, cloth, and vehicle physics configuration.
keyTakeaways: Enable Chaos physics and set up rigid body simulation on Static Meshes
Create Geometry Collections for destructible objects using Fracture Mode
Configure Chaos Cloth simulation on Skeletal Meshes for fabric physics
Set up Chaos Vehicle movement with suspension, wheels, and engine curves

resources.title: Virtual Production with nDisplay
resources.description: Advanced virtual production workflow using nDisplay for multi-display LED wall setups, real-time compositing, and in-camera VFX with UE5.
keyTakeaways: Set up an nDisplay configuration for multi-node LED wall rendering
Calibrate camera tracking with LiveLink for real-time compositing
Use Inner Frustum rendering for perspective-correct LED backgrounds
Configure color calibration and latency compensation for on-set accuracy

resources.title: Introduction to Blueprints | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official live training covering Blueprint fundamentals — variables, functions, events, flow control, and building a small interactive prototype from scratch.
keyTakeaways: Understand the Blueprint event graph, functions, and macros
Create variables and use Get/Set nodes for state management
Wire up input events and gameplay triggers with Blueprint logic
Debug Blueprints using breakpoints and the watch window

resources.title: Blueprint Communications | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official training on Blueprint communication patterns — direct references, casting, Blueprint Interfaces, and Event Dispatchers for decoupled systems.
keyTakeaways: Use direct Blueprint references and casting for simple communication
Implement Blueprint Interfaces for decoupled cross-actor messaging
Set up Event Dispatchers for observer-pattern notifications
Choose the right communication pattern based on coupling needs

resources.title: Enhanced Input | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official Inside Unreal episode on UE5's Enhanced Input system — Input Actions, Input Mapping Contexts, modifiers, triggers, and runtime rebinding.
keyTakeaways: Create Input Actions as data assets for movement, look, and interact
Set up Input Mapping Contexts to bind actions to keys/buttons
Use Modifiers (Negate, Dead Zone, Swizzle) to transform raw input
Switch mapping contexts at runtime for different gameplay modes

resources.title: UMG UI in 300 Seconds | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Fast-paced official overview of UMG — Widget Blueprints, the UMG Designer, Canvas Panel layout, and spawning/removing widgets at runtime.
keyTakeaways: Create a Widget Blueprint and use the UMG Designer for layout
Use Canvas Panel, Horizontal/Vertical Boxes for responsive UI
Spawn widgets at runtime with Create Widget and Add to Viewport
Bind UI elements to gameplay variables for dynamic HUD updates

resources.title: Introduction to UMG | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official live training on building UIs with UMG — HUD creation, main menus, button styling, text binding, and input mode switching.
keyTakeaways: Build a full HUD with health bars, ammo counters, and crosshairs
Create main menus with button navigation and input mode switching
Use bindings and animations to make UI elements feel responsive
Handle focus and gamepad navigation for accessible UI

resources.title: Sequencer 101: Triggering Gameplay | Unreal Engine 5 Cinematics
resources.description: Official tutorial on using UE5 Sequencer to trigger gameplay events — camera cuts, event tracks, binding actors, and blending cinematic sequences with gameplay.
keyTakeaways: Create Level Sequences and add camera cuts with shot tracks
Use Event Tracks to fire Blueprint events at specific frames
Bind possessable actors and control their properties over time
Blend between cinematic cameras and gameplay cameras smoothly

resources.title: Creating Cinematics with Sequencer | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official Inside Unreal episode on cinematic production with Sequencer — multi-camera setups, skeletal animation tracks, audio sync, and Movie Render Queue.
keyTakeaways: Set up multi-camera rigs with automatic switching in Sequencer
Animate skeletal meshes and blend between animation clips
Add audio tracks and sync sound effects to visual events
Render high-quality output using Movie Render Queue with anti-aliasing

resources.title: Introduction to AI with Blueprints | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official live training covering AI fundamentals — AI Controllers, Behavior Trees, Blackboards, Nav Mesh navigation, and AI Perception for detection.
keyTakeaways: Set up an AI Controller and assign it to a character Blueprint
Build Behavior Trees with sequences, selectors, and tasks
Use Blackboard keys to store and share AI state data
Configure NavMesh Bounds Volume for AI pathfinding

resources.title: AI Perception System | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official deep dive into UE5's AI Perception system — sight, hearing, damage senses, and integrating perception with Behavior Trees for reactive AI.
keyTakeaways: Configure sight, hearing, and damage perception senses on AI
Set up AI Perception Stimuli Sources on player characters
React to perception events (On Target Perceived) in Behavior Trees
Tune perception parameters for stealth gameplay (FOV, range, age)

resources.title: Introduction to Materials | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official training on UE5 Material Editor — PBR workflow, texture sampling, material parameters, instances, and building common material types (metal, glass, fabric).
keyTakeaways: Understand PBR material inputs: Base Color, Metallic, Roughness, Normal
Create Material Instances for efficient parameter tweaking without recompiling
Use Texture Sample nodes and coordinate manipulation for tiling/UV effects
Build dynamic materials with Material Parameter Collections for runtime changes

resources.title: Substance & Quixel Integration | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official overview of using Quixel Bridge and Megascans within UE5 — importing photogrammetry assets, setting up Nanite meshes, and applying scanned materials.
keyTakeaways: Use Quixel Bridge (built into UE5) to browse and import Megascans assets
Auto-enable Nanite on imported Megascans meshes for unlimited detail
Apply scanned surface materials and customize them with blend layers
Organize large asset libraries with naming conventions and folder structure

resources.title: Introduction to C++ Programming | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official live training on C++ for Unreal — project setup, AActor, UObject, UPROPERTY/UFUNCTION macros, and how C++ and Blueprints work together.
keyTakeaways: Set up a C++ project and understand the Unreal build system (UBT)
Create C++ classes inheriting from AActor and ACharacter
Expose C++ properties to Blueprints with UPROPERTY and UFUNCTION
Understand the relationship between C++ base classes and Blueprint children

resources.title: Networking & Multiplayer | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official Inside Unreal episode on UE5 networking — server-client model, replication, RPCs, relevancy, and testing multiplayer locally with multiple sessions.
keyTakeaways: Understand UE5's authoritative server model and client prediction
Mark variables as Replicated with DOREPLIFETIME for state sync
Implement Server, Client, and Multicast RPCs for remote function calls
Test multiplayer locally using the Play-In-Editor net mode settings

resources.title: Collision & Physics Interaction | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official training on collision setup — collision channels, presets, object responses, overlap vs block events, and line/sphere trace usage.
keyTakeaways: Understand collision channels (WorldStatic, WorldDynamic, Pawn, etc.)
Configure collision presets for blocking, overlapping, and ignoring
Use On Component Begin Overlap events for trigger volumes
Perform line traces and sphere traces for raycast-based interaction

resources.title: Character Movement Component | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official deep dive into UE5's Character Movement Component — movement modes (walk, fly, swim), acceleration, braking, and customizing character physics.
keyTakeaways: Configure walking, jumping, flying, and swimming movement modes
Tune Max Walk Speed, Acceleration, and Braking Deceleration for game feel
Implement custom movement modes for mechanics like wall-running
Handle networked character movement with prediction and correction

resources.title: Packaging Your Project | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official tutorial on packaging your UE5 game — build configurations, project settings for default map, cooking content, and creating distributable builds.
keyTakeaways: Set the default Game Map and Game Mode in Project Settings before packaging
Choose Development vs Shipping build configuration based on your needs
Package for Windows/Mac/Linux using File → Package Project
Troubleshoot common packaging errors (missing modules, cook failures)

resources.title: Level Design Workflow | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official workflow guide for level design in UE5 — BSP blockout, modular kit-bashing, lighting passes, and iterative design from greybox to final art.
keyTakeaways: Use BSP brushes and modeling tools for rapid greybox prototyping
Apply modular meshes with grid snapping for clean kit-bash levels
Iterate through layout, lighting, and detail passes for polish
Playtest early and often using PIE to validate spatial flow

resources.title: Gameplay Ability System | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official overview of the Gameplay Ability System (GAS) — Ability System Components, Gameplay Abilities, Gameplay Effects, Gameplay Tags, and Attribute Sets.
keyTakeaways: Set up Ability System Component and Attribute Sets on characters
Create Gameplay Abilities with activation, cooldown, and cost logic
Use Gameplay Effects to modify attributes (damage, healing, buffs)
Organize game state with Gameplay Tags for clean condition checking

resources.title: Data-Driven Design with Data Tables | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official training on data-driven game design — Data Tables, Struct-based rows, CSV import/export, and runtime lookup for items, weapons, and abilities.
keyTakeaways: Create Structs and Data Tables for game entities (items, stats, abilities)
Import/export Data Tables from CSV for external editing
Look up Data Table rows at runtime from Blueprint and C++
Use Soft Object References in Data Tables for deferred asset loading

resources.title: Post Process Effects | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official guide to UE5 Post Process Volumes — bloom, color grading, depth of field, exposure, and building stylized visual looks.
keyTakeaways: Set up Post Process Volumes with Infinite Extent for global effects
Configure bloom, lens flares, and chromatic aberration for cinematic looks
Use LUT-based color grading to establish a visual tone
Control exposure with auto-exposure settings or manual EV100

resources.title: Foliage & Vegetation in UE5 | Feature Highlight
resources.description: Official feature highlight on UE5 foliage tools — paint mode, procedural placement, Nanite foliage support, and wind interaction setup.
keyTakeaways: Use the Foliage Paint tool for manual vegetation placement
Configure density, scale randomization, and ground slope alignment
Enable Nanite on foliage meshes for massive polygon counts without LOD
Set up Simple Grass Wind material for natural foliage animation

resources.title: Mass Entity Framework | Unreal Fest 2023
resources.description: Official Unreal Fest talk on the Mass Entity framework — Entity Component System architecture for thousands of entities, processors, traits, and integration with SmartObjects.
keyTakeaways: Understand the Mass Entity ECS architecture (Entities, Fragments, Processors)
Create Mass Entity Configs with Traits for bulk spawning
Write custom Processors for simulation logic (movement, avoidance)
Integrate Mass Entity with SmartObjects for crowd behavior

resources.title: Building AI with State Trees | Unreal Fest
resources.description: Official Unreal Fest session on State Trees — UE5's next-gen AI behavior framework. Covers State Tree architecture, tasks, conditions, and comparison with Behavior Trees.
keyTakeaways: Understand State Trees as a modern alternative to Behavior Trees
Create States with Enter Conditions and linked Tasks for modular AI
Use Gameplay Tag conditions for scalable state transitions
Combine State Trees with SmartObjects for context-aware AI behavior

resources.title: Landscape Sculpting & Painting | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official training on UE5 landscape tools — creating landscapes, sculpting terrain, painting multiple material layers, and importing heightmaps.
keyTakeaways: Create a Landscape with configurable section size and resolution
Use sculpt, smooth, flatten, and erosion tools for terrain shaping
Paint multiple landscape material layers (grass, dirt, rock) with auto-blending
Import external heightmaps (16-bit PNG) for real-world terrain

resources.title: Water System Overview | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official overview of UE5's Water System plugin — oceans, rivers, lakes, water body editing, buoyancy, and underwater post-processing.
keyTakeaways: Enable the Water plugin and place Water Body actors (Ocean, River, Lake)
Edit water splines and wave parameters for natural-looking water
Set up buoyancy components for floating objects and swimming characters
Configure underwater post-processing effects and fog

resources.title: Virtual Shadow Maps | Inside Unreal
resources.description: Official deep dive into Virtual Shadow Maps — how VSM replaces traditional cascaded shadow maps, performance tuning, and interaction with Nanite.
keyTakeaways: Understand how Virtual Shadow Maps provide pixel-accurate shadows
Configure VSM settings: page pool size, cache invalidation, and distance
Know how VSM automatically leverages Nanite geometry for shadow rendering
Profile and tune VSM performance with stat Shadow and GPU timings

resources.title: Gameplay Mechanics with Blueprints | Live Training | Unreal Engine
resources.description: Official live training on building gameplay mechanics — doors, switches, pickups, health systems, and spawning with Blueprint. Complete hands-on project.
keyTakeaways: Build interactive doors and switches with overlap triggers
Create pickup items with Blueprint interfaces for modularity
Implement a basic health and damage system using variables and events
Spawn actors at runtime and control their lifecycle

resources.title: Modeling Tools in UE5 | Feature Highlight
resources.description: Official feature highlight of UE5's built-in Modeling Mode — PolyEdit, mesh booleans, UV tools, and creating game-ready meshes without leaving the editor.
keyTakeaways: Enter Modeling Mode and use PolyEdit for vertex/edge/face editing
Use boolean operations (union, subtract, intersect) to combine meshes
Generate and edit UVs with the built-in UV editor tools
Export edited meshes as static mesh assets for your project
